newsitem.title: USA: CBOT wheat called one to two cents higher.
newsitem.headline: CBOT wheat called one to two cents higher.

text.p: CBOT wheat futures were called to open one to two cents per bushel higher on Thursday's announcement by the EU to halt the EU weekly export tenders for wheat, traders said.
Mounting concerns about dry weather in key European wheat growing areas also were noted, traders said.

Wheat futures remain volatile amid conflicting signals about the extent of freeze damage that occurred last weekend in key U.S. Great Plains hard red winter wheat growing areas. A meteorologist Friday called for warmer weather this weekend but possible cold weather was cited for next week.
CBOT's Project A overnight trend for wheat was one cent per bushel higher to two cents lower.
